website_summaries.verdict: Solid drop-forged steel makes for a reliable hammer that is low in cost.
pros: Easy to grip,  hardened head, and very effective on the job
cons: The head isn't as strong and sturdy as that of some other hammers

customer_reviews.title: otherwise they need to check their temperatures or have QC inspect these better because the material is just too soft
customer_reviews.text: Was excited about this purchase and took it out with me to go quartz hunting the other week. The neck began to bend while using the pick after about an hour of light excavation use. This made it unwieldy to use on either side. I really doubt this is dropped forged steel, otherwise they need to check their temperatures or have QC inspect these better because the material is just too soft. At the rate the tip flattened, I would probably go through this in 1-2 years after having to resharpen the pick constantly. Am sending it back and will likely save up for an estwing..
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Weak neck bent after a few hits
customer_reviews.text: High hopes but just a cheap pos went out and picked at a few rocks and with in 40 min of walking and picking it is now bent in a u shape the neck is too weak don’t wast your time on this one buy one that’s of higher quality or you will have regrets 😭
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hammer broke
customer_reviews.text: I got this hammer to crack open some rocks. The first time using it, the silver metal chipped and I can see the inside of the hammer. So, I am returning this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soft steel lasted 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Lasted maybe 20 minutes and it's bent significantly. Soft steel. Would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Good hammer for Rock Biters
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband, who is a bit of a rock fiend. He says it makes the loveliest CHINKY CHINKY noise when he's out trying to find his treasure by banging on rocks. It is a superbly well-made tool, with a nice grip that hopefully will last. So far, so good, and it's been out on a fair number of rock-smashing hikes. It feels good in the hand, even for me, and I have tiny little dainty lady hands. (Who am I joking? I will never be a hand model with these digits. They work.)
customer_reviews.author: Scarlette Ibis

customer_reviews.title: Solid but prone to rust
customer_reviews.text: Good heft & balance, the underside of the head isn't polished up & has some pits/imperfections, but that doesn't effect performance. Rusts easier then I'd like, but not surprised as it seemed to be quite hard steel. I use it for some rock smashing, but it's also become my go to hammer for just about everything & the spike end is also perfect for moving firewood around without getting your hands dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Bladow

customer_reviews.title: Great to cut my coconuts open!
customer_reviews.text: I think it would be the perfect stainless steel hammer that I will use exclusively and only for hammering my fresh coconuts open!!! I did not want to use a hammer that was not stainless steel and I did not want to use a hammer use for any other purpose than I have at home. This is exclusively for my coconuts because I love fresh coconuts And coconut juice from the coconuts because the coconut juice on the store shelves are very nasty!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara T.

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer.
customer_reviews.text: This hammer arrived exactly as described. It feels hefty and well made with quality steel. I've used it for prospecting several times and it has performed better than hammers at 3 times the price. There is no manufacturer stamp so I assume it's made in China, (like everything else is these days). All in all, you could spend a lot more for less quality. No complaints from this department.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Rocks

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. I'm not much a geo-hunter so I'm not really sure what is considered good. I got this to break granite pieces off when I start sculpting stone into art. the pointy portion seems to dull easily, while the front seems to dent easily as well. overall it's a good product and maybe I'm using it on the stones.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Love this for a mature rock hounding
customer_reviews.text: We love to go "rock hounding" in Colorado. This pick is very sturdy and we have pounded a lot of rocks with it. Has a nice rubber covering on the handle so it won't slip and when you hit a solid rock it does provide some cushion. Liked it so well we bought another one. It will rust so make sure to dry it off if it gets wet!
customer_reviews.author: Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Nifty little rock hammer for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: I asked my husband to buy this for my Christmas gift. I have been an avid rock collector for most of my life and after we relocated from Florida to the Rocky Mountains and I am thrilled to have this sturdy but lightweight little rock hammer to take with me on hikes. I did comparitive shopping and found this to be the most versatile and solid tool for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.text: There is not that much to think about here: somewhere in our shared distant prehistory, one of our wonderful monkey-brained ancestors uncovered the utility and pleasure in picking up one object to strike another. Fast forward several tens of thousands of years, and I want to utilize the convoluted complexities of modern technology to advertise how great it feels to hold this inexpensive, sturdy little rock hammer and smack all variety of stone into teeny mineral mincemeat. For all the things you can decide to do with either end of this base tool, it's worth the low cost just to rediscover your inner primate. Ten out of ten smaller rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great feel.
customer_reviews.text: I received it yesterday. It only took a day and a half to arrive and was wrapped with clear wrap. it feels really solid but when you look closely on the separation from the metal and the handle theres still uncleaned superglue or something. Also on the metal part theres bubbling from the treatment they used.
customer_reviews.author: Alex V

customer_reviews.title: It's a pointy hammer, what do you expect?
customer_reviews.text: It's a pointy hammer. If you hit the right kind of rock in the right place, it splits the rock. It's got a good balance and a secure grip. It's not stainless steel, so if your grandson leaves it out in the rain, it will rust. But otherwise it's a good pointy hammer for breaking things.
customer_reviews.author: StrongDreams

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the right kid.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 9 year old grand son, along with a rock identification book and satchel to keep his rocks and hammer in. He loves to carry his "kit" and go "mining" where ever he can find rocks. I added some safety glasses, which I recommend doing, since fragments fly now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Great for Fossil Hunting
customer_reviews.text: It's a hammer. It's great for smashing rocks. I was able to use this to dig up some small shell fossils in Mississippi limestone, which is exactly what I bought it for, so I would say that it worked exactly as expected. I wouldn't use it for precision fossil hunting, but the fossils I was searching for were small (<1 inch) and moderately abundant, so this allowed me to split the limestone along natural seams to uncover the fossils.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M

customer_reviews.title: It is a good rock pick for the money and good for minor ...
customer_reviews.text: Although it claims to be a 32 oz. hammer, it isn't. I 've been in construction for over 40 years and a contractor for 32 of those years. ALL hammer weights are the weight of the head and NOT the weight of the entire hammer. This entire hammer weighs 32 oz., the head is about 12 oz., so don't buy it thinking your going to get something with a real heavy head. It is a good rock pick for the money and good for minor demolition.
customer_reviews.author: robert c

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly servicable
customer_reviews.text: I'm a geologist and I have used this hammer for 4 years now. Works great, my only complaint is that the grip has come off and I am not sure what glue to use to get it to adhere again. Even with the loose grip I'd say this works just as well as any other hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Karst_is_a_funny_word

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use this to break open rocks in my front yard, I'm not a geologist by any means but I've hit alot of rocks very hard with both sides, it's dulled a little but otherwise is still in pretty much perfect condition. Also very little sparks, and works better than a regular hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for field work including hard rocks
customer_reviews.text: I sat and hammered away on some big chunks of granite trying to get some good pieces of muscovite and biotite and my hammer is still in excellent condition. Yes, it may not be as fancy as the Estwing hammer which was a popular choice about the time I went to field camp, but it serves its purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: Tanis Coralee Leonhardi

customer_reviews.title: My 10 year old granddaughter acted like she hit the million dollar lottery when she opened ...
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old granddaughter acted like she hit the million dollar lottery when she opened the box that contained the hammer and a 2 pound bag of rocks!!!! Lucky I get to see it all year on video!!! Makes me laugh, I've got a little geologist of my own!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Rock Hammer
customer_reviews.text: Rock Hammer feels really nice and is made of sturdy material. I used this for a 6 week field camp as a geology major in college so it's gotten a lot of use in the short amount of time I had it. It's comfortable to hold and hasn't sustained any damage when I was using it on really hard material. There is nothing bad to say about this product. All in all a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Weeks - Obsidian Home Creations OwnerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not an Estwing
customer_reviews.text: It was a shorter handle than I expected. Next time I will buy the Estwing Rock hammer. This has a rather blunt tip and is way too soft to break open rocks. It has been repurposed to use for weeding and does a good job there.
customer_reviews.author: chickadee

customer_reviews.title: This Works!  Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use when prospecting in Arizona. Have used it in weeding, gardening, breaking rock, and other nefarious activities. Amazingly strong and the weight (heavy) really does the job. Have hit hard rocks and broken them without even scratching it. This is a good one!
customer_reviews.author: Living the Dream

customer_reviews.title: Not a rock hammer
customer_reviews.text: Hit a rock 4 times with minimal force let's say the rock is fine but this hammers tip is rounded over and the metal flew everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: russell stewart

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for any of your rock hounds.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this with Geodes from Morocco for a friend so she could properly pick them apart and hopefully not smash them into several pieces. It worked well, it would be perfect if I had a rock saw for a clean cut, but with the hammer it makes the experience more personal, and give the piece a little more of a rugged look. I would highly recommend for any of your rock hounds.
customer_reviews.author: Nicho

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Don't spend extra cash on a rock-hammer. This one is great. The grip is solid, and the rubber isn't likely to shift and bind with time. The construction is very solid. Another reviewer mentioned they felt like they'd break it; they're reviewing a different item. This is a single piece of steel, not a hollow tube with a hammer head welded to the end. It breaks rocks, shears cleavages, and has helped me find a couple of fossils and an extremely unlikely geode. It wins.
customer_reviews.author: jonesyjonesjones

customer_reviews.title: Item came precisely as advertised and in excellent shape, perfectly packaged.
customer_reviews.text: Everything I wanted in a rock hammer, this provided. I'm an amateur naturalist who uses this for rock hounding, fossil hunting, flipping rocks or cover boards looking for herps. etc. works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: David A Fouchey

customer_reviews.title: Beware! It 30 oz!!
customer_reviews.text: Beware !!!! This is 30 oz rock pick, not 20 oz!! I specifically ordered this for my kid to use in our rockhound trip because it stated 20 oz. But it's not! I am really unhappy because I bought my first one in 2013 and that rock pick was in perfect size. This one is way too heavy for kids. Very disappointing and won't buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Manufacturer

customer_reviews.title: Great for chipping welding slag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pic hammer...I bought this as a chipping hammer for welding..I work in a shop that builds and rebuilds coal mining equiptment...I must say that I know I'm not using it for the purpose it's intended for but this thing is 10 times better than a welding chipping hammer...I've used this for over a month now and the point is still sharp...I've would recommend this hammer for the purpose of chipping slag off of welds
customer_reviews.author: james wright

customer_reviews.title: Hammer works well and feels very good to hold and swing
customer_reviews.text: Hammer works well and feels very good to hold and swing. When using in the desert the glue holding the rubber handle melted and the metal can hammer and handle now be easily removed by pulling on it a little. This doesn't affect normal use but something to be aware of if using it in the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Couple of rock hounds love it.
customer_reviews.text: It was so funny. He opened this last Christmas and laughed out loud. Then I opened my gift and it was a rock hammer. I like his a little better, and he loves it. We have chipped tourmaline out of a road cut and broken the worthless parts of rocks off our smoky quartz and copper sulfate (sulfide?) so we didn't have to carry it out. Very useful tool!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda H.

customer_reviews.title: Received item not as high quality as image shown
customer_reviews.text: Item is quite a bit lower quality than the image on Amazon. The machining quality is very crude and the tips are not consistently machined. Mine had glue and some sort of debris at the bottoms.
customer_reviews.author: jmy-umma

customer_reviews.title: Science for Grandkids
customer_reviews.text: My Grandkids needed some expanding of their outlooks. This product will help to introduce them to gems and lapidary work as well as to gold and silver smithing for jewelry as well as learning some Geology. All around a good experience for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Steve in CA

customer_reviews.title: He is out in thei field quite a bit and has loved using this rock hammer to crack open geodes
customer_reviews.text: We bought this hammer for our brother who is a geology major. He is out in thei field quite a bit and has loved using this rock hammer to crack open geodes. It works better than the last cheapie he had from the campus store that got lost it the move (it was awakardly balanced). Pros: Good balance and weight Cons: could have a better grip and your wrist definitily feels it after a while
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful hammer for breaking geodes. Product description is accurate and i've seen similar products worth triple this price. It weighs approximately 20 ounces/ 11 inches and forged from one piece of polish steel. It comes with a reusable heavy-duty plastic tip cover. One side is flat, while the other side has a pick. Perfect for breaking rocks open. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: TDE

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: Okay for the money i suppose. Not the greatest but not the worst. I got it just to pass the time doing something fun with my son opening quarts. I wouldnt use it for professional prospecting
customer_reviews.author: Leviathan

customer_reviews.title: Overall an excellent rock basher
customer_reviews.text: Overall an excellent rock basher. Bought it as a present for the young 'un who wanted to Minecraft for real. We no longer have any large rocks in the backyard ;) 4 stars because the forging's a bit crusty and the handle's a bit uncomfortable in my mitt. Not an Estwing, but a good tool nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Big and sharp. Bought for my 8 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: Big and sharp. Bought for my 8 year old son who loves geology. A bit dangerous but high quality. Definite supervision needed.
customer_reviews.author: tmulanax

customer_reviews.title: Love the handle
customer_reviews.text: Great for small handed women or big handed man. Husband and I both use this as we both find weekend projects. Good quality, strong durable and will last for years to come
customer_reviews.author: Dawna Skaggs

customer_reviews.title: Granite beware! Busted through some tough stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Withstood a ton of hammering on solid granite. After a few years and multiple rock hunting seasons, the edge has dulled a bit but I still find it useful. I have had no issues with the grip, which is still in tact and works fine. Overall I find it to be a good hammer especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: BradleyTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Its a hammer, it breaks things and does it ...
customer_reviews.text: Its a hammer, it breaks things and does it well. Pick end is plenty sharp however it is a cheap tool made in china and shows in a few places. The bottom of the head and pick have casting marks that form a ridge down the middle. also with exposure to water, my hammer started to show little rust spots everywhere the metal is pitted. Neither of these issues impede function however and it still does its job well.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Like a rock
customer_reviews.text: Was okay , handle could have been better but I did put it through a lot of rough times. Everest is no joke but someone had to save those poor pandas
customer_reviews.author: Snowimeno0

customer_reviews.title: built to last, and looks nice too!
customer_reviews.text: I got this in preparation for a rockhounding trip. It worked perfectly, so much so that it pretty much replaced my shovel for digging through soil to find artifacts. It's lightweight, but is tough and gets the job done. For the price, I had questioned whether it would be of high enough quality to withstand use, but after a weekend of ripping through soils, picking rocks out of solid walls, and other general use, it came out without a scratch. And this is not a functional comment, but it just looks nice too! Highly pleased with this order and would purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: It's a really sturdy tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: What more is there to say about an 11 inch rock hammer? This thing is a dainty little beast. I've used it to pry many rocks out of their holes in the earth as well as a hammer, an assist climbing up a hill, and even a way to carry more by hanging a bag off of it hanging in a bag that i've already tied off. It's a really sturdy tool for the price, you won't regret your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kay B.

customer_reviews.title: They have worked great for my family.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several of these over the years because my family goes rock hunting quite a bit. It's a fun, cheap hobby we can all do together. We've never had a hammer fail. It should be noted that these are Pointed-tip rock hammers not Chisel-edge rock hammers. I wish they sold Chisel-edge rock hammers. Anyway, I have several and they have held up well over the years.I have four kids armed with them, two of which could break an anvil with a feather, and so far no problems. I will probably buy several more before it's all said and done for the kids' friends. Decent product at a price you can't find anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry and Karen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fossil hunting
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought this for trilobites here in New York and after using it the first time I’ll never not have this anytime I’m looking for fossils...Wright is perfect, handle feels nice, all around great hammer
customer_reviews.author: JonnyG

customer_reviews.title: hmmm
customer_reviews.text: At first pickup, It feels off. I tried to save money but my estwing is just better ( Balance, grip thickness, grip material). It feels like a torture tool for your hands. harbor freight tool rules for this one (if your in a pinch, great tool. professionals/ hobbyist/everyone should seek better)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This product rocks.
customer_reviews.text: This rock pick hammer was purchased for a fossil finding field trip at the last moment. The delivery was quick and inexpensive. The product performed wonderfully and my first grader had a blast finding a bucket full of fossils. The purchase was well worth it in every way. The service was right on the money with everything Amazon promised it would be. Nice to get what you pay for and get what you expect.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my ten year old son. He loves it and uses it often. The hammer is well made and it takes a good bit of abuse. The hammer has plenty of weight and the handle appears to be well formed. The chisel point is not so sharp as to be a precision instrument but works great for general rock breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: It does the job at a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a friend of mine that is always collecting rocks. He had no hammer and no guide book, so I bought him both. He has been hammering away ever since and says that it is just want he needed. Since I am a birder and not a rock-person I can't speak about the utility of this hammer from personal experience, I can say that my friend is very happy with this hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy B. Riley

customer_reviews.title: Pretty satisfying
customer_reviews.text: personally having never used a rock pick before it is a very affordable and fun to use tool but be warned if you try mining into solid stone you will scrape it up and remove the point due to the fact that i live in Texas the most i have to deal with is some limestone or sand stone making this a great tool for chipping away at the layers I do advise buying a set of chisel's with this hammer but so far so good i am very pleased with how fast it arrived in the mail and how sturdy it is i absolutely recommend this to the beginner rock enthusiast!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Gigley

customer_reviews.title: Great Hammer For The Price
customer_reviews.text: This hammer is pretty solid. Went out to an Ordovician fossil cut. The hammer worked great for the price. We managed two find four trilobites, and a cephalopod fragment, thanks to this hammer. Two little qualms with the hammer. The first is that is it isn't really well balanced, and the second is the handle isn't very cushioned. Neither is a factor if you aren't swinging it for hours on end. The good news is that it took a real beating and shows no real wear.
customer_reviews.author: virtualdirt

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Geology class field trips.
customer_reviews.text: Still using this hammer without any issues. Can't beat it for the money. Carried me through school and work.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Mackelburg

customer_reviews.title: Hammeriffic. This little guy will smash your favorite rocks day and night.
customer_reviews.text: Dude. This is a pretty solid hammer. Much heavier than I anticipated. I took her out to the desert and smashed all kinds of rocks without any damage to either end of this hammer. I dug a few holes and then hit some fallen logs just to end out the hike with a full spectrum of digging and smashing. Found no gold but crushing and pounding with no regard for damaging my equipment is priceless.
customer_reviews.author: 1danadrive

customer_reviews.title: but really great bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Really decent geology pick for the price. Slightly unfinished and slightly soft steel; but really great bang for your buck. There are several picks for similar price that are offered on amazon. We bought 3 and all had different lengths and weights, depending on the batch. Fairly unfinished, but if you're digging or cracking rocks that shouldn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: HoyHoy

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool!
customer_reviews.text: Can't wait to use this come Sept 2020 on my excavating trip!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why I bought this but I love it its good quality and lightweight
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: This is a good rock hammer
customer_reviews.text: This is a good rock hammer, but I seem to still be using my garden pick more often due to the wide scoop blade on one end. Maybe it's the materials I'm going after but I'll keep this with me in case I feel the need to bust some rocks in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A dandy good little hammer except the hole at base of handle ...
customer_reviews.text: A dandy good little hammer except the hole at base of handle isn't big enough to put a safety chord through it. So you need to drill out about a 3/16" hole thru it to put your chord through, if you want a safety chord. The hole on each side of the handle was probably was the result of the handle manufacture, but it makes a perfect hole to put a safety chord through.
customer_reviews.author: James L Jones

customer_reviews.title: Can't prospect without a good hammer and this is it
customer_reviews.text: Checking out the Cerbats and this should make the job easier. Good grip and well built
customer_reviews.author: William N. Ressegue

customer_reviews.title: Great little pick for the price.
customer_reviews.text: My son has been prospecting hard rock mines. The pick fits in a back pack and has stood up to heavy use. The end is starting to wear a little after heavy use. Other prospectors see this pick and want one. It is weighted just right for working over your head and small enough for tight spots.
customer_reviews.author: eeksmom

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product for my seven-year-old son! He loves to chip away at sandstone rock with it and so far it has held up well!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: My 10 yr old rock hound loves this hammer. He is just beginning and it really peaked his interest even more. Highly recommend the Estes leather sheath for protection whether they actually wear on a belt. Highly recommend the Smithsonian rocks and minerals book to get with it and I also purchased inexpensive plastic containers so he can separate and label rocks. The loupe was a hit as well he loves that thing!
customer_reviews.author: lakemama

customer_reviews.title: using this as a forge hammer
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this as a forge hammer, it isn't the tinning hammer I thought it was when I bought it but it works great, and is solid metal through and through
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Rock Hammer Is OK!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful Rock Hammer that should get through a few rocks for me. As a fossicker this will bring me Much Pleasure out in the areas I love looking for stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wood

customer_reviews.title: This thing is heavy
customer_reviews.text: I used to carry a knife in the woods, but this thing is more lethal than any knife I have. But for real, its very sharp which makes it easy to break open some pretty tough rocks. A geologist dream, definitely nice to get your own quality hammer (like this one) and get away from the 250 year old university ones that broke Jesus out of the tomb and are not dull as crap.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: I use this to break rocks & it works well
customer_reviews.author: ts0215

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact rock hammer. Good solid build, a comfortable to use... Kinda wish Id ordered the next size up, but this one fits perfectly in my bag and swing well.
customer_reviews.author: j337

customer_reviews.title: Decent hammer for the cost
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty good hammer although I think that it's not hard enough for rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner Pick Hammer for the price! Bought it for my budding geologist.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as people are saying
customer_reviews.text: Ok for occasional or backup use. But for more serious use the balance is off and the handle grip slides off. The Estwing is worth the additional money.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: its a good hammer strong and great for the price
customer_reviews.text: its a good hammer strong and great for the price , its strong, and very pointy, i swung it as hard as i could on my work bench and it got stuck and had to pry it out , only con is the handle is very slimy , slippery so thats my only down side.
customer_reviews.author: NICE

customer_reviews.title: This works perfect, it is great for collecting rock samples
customer_reviews.text: This works perfect, it is great for collecting rock samples, and it is much cheaper than the other brand. The hammer is one piece throughout with a silicone rubber grip. You won't break this without devising a plan to break it, it really is that tough. It stays sharp, this is a real tool for you or the kids. Remember to wear safety goggles.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lipscomb

customer_reviews.title: Decent Rock Hammer
customer_reviews.text: This rock hammer will meet your expectations.. as long as you go easy on it. I found that the hammer is quite comfortable and seems to be well balanced for when I want to strike with it. The only downside was that the metal isn't the most durable. During my light use with it, the hammer and the pick would easily dent. I have used it for opening up geodes and occasional pick work when pulling out fossils and the pick is very blunt now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Yes, This is Indeed What a Hammer Looks Like.
customer_reviews.text: It's a hammer. I mean, one would think it's fairly self explanatory. It's no particular wonder. I didn't get chills up my back because it was so great, but I must say, of the few hammers I've had (this being the only hammer I've had), it serves its purpose of which it doesn't have much (I don't do much handy work, and, in retrospect, buying a hammer was perhaps not one of my best decisions).
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Professional Quality 20 oz Rock Hammer
customer_reviews.text: Top grade material, and I say this from years of experience swinging a hammer. Shipped very quickly and packaged nicely. Looking forward to putting it to use.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Nice. Only had it for a few weeks for ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Only had it for a few weeks for use with my rock tumbling hobby. The only action the hammer has seen was about 10 strikes to some marble and about 100 from my 5yr old breaking my good patio bricks. Ugh. Back to the point - this is awesome for $17, why do other companies charge $45 for a rock hammer?!! Buy this unless you plan too prospect in the old west
customer_reviews.author: J Santos

customer_reviews.title: My first rock hammer
customer_reviews.text: This is my first rock hammer so I am not sure how it compares to other hammers but it worked well for me. The first time i used it was this week end on a trip with the local college geology professor collecting fossils. He said that it was on the heavy end and that the pick is thicker than normal, so I guess that means that it is sturdy. I've used it on limestone and some softer local rock so fare. I use it for collecting fossils so I don't expect it to get dull fast,nor has it done so. Again this is my first rock hammer so my opinion may change in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan T

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt break any quarts stones when I go mining :( ....guess i can use it as a weapon
customer_reviews.author: MrAllGrain

customer_reviews.title: Holding it hard.
customer_reviews.text: I like the whole hammer. It has a Nice balance. It works by own heviness. I collect stones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: its cool. its a hammer
customer_reviews.text: i havnt used it in the field but ive smacked things with it and it is very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for a rock hammer for a while. Tried this and for my needs it is perfect. Just the right size and weight especially if you are climbing and hiking long distances. In addition the weight distribution makes the rock pick very functional. Finally, since I am out in areas with high populations of mountain lions, bobcats, etc. the pick can be used as a defense if my aim is poor, so it has replaced my tomahawk. A perfect tool for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: All Lives Matter

customer_reviews.title: but she was delighted with it and has taken it on many field ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a gift for a friend who was taking a geology class, so I have never used the hammer myself, but she was delighted with it and has taken it on many field trips with no problems. Her interest in geology has become continuous and long term with more classes and more field trips.
customer_reviews.author: Carroll Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Husband is concrete mixer truck driver and ordered this to chip concrete off truck. Works great! Others drivers were impressed with it.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Crow

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, decent weight in hand.
customer_reviews.text: This is your basic starter rock hammer. Practical, works decently, best for the price range. It will wear down quickly on harder rock, but it is perfect for a beginner!
customer_reviews.author: Gen Marie

customer_reviews.title: Rock hunting hammer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for rock hunting and was not disappointed. Just the right size and weight for women. Feels good in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Izzysmom55

customer_reviews.title: This is a great hammer! It is a solid piece
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hammer! It is a solid piece. My son has used it for digging up rocks and for vreaking rocks and loves it. It is very heavy and of good quality. I feel it will last a long time even with constant use.
customer_reviews.author: Mom_2_7_dudes

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Hammer. Great little Price.
customer_reviews.text: Although I am no expert on rock hammers, this thing just did the job in a matter of seconds. Quartz for rock tumbler. DANGER: WEAR PROTECTION !!
customer_reviews.author: deadbugs

customer_reviews.title: It,s a rock hammer
customer_reviews.text: What is there to say, its a rock hammer. I will be using it this summer in Cazenovia Creek george to hunt fossils and indian artifacts.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores Monk

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my kids. This is much bigger than ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my kids. This is much bigger than I pictured in my mind. My 9 year old son loves his and takes it every time we go rock hunting. My 12 old daughter prefers her smaller hammer. This one is just too big and heavy for her. She never used hers so now I have an extra one just sitting around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for picking through small levels of rock
customer_reviews.text: Living in south Texas, I have a lot of limestone underground. Every time I plant anything it's a battle to dig down. None of my jobs have been too large at any given time, so this tool has been a perfect fit. It blasts right through any rock that I run into and has made the process much easier for me.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Dmitriev

customer_reviews.title: This hammer is what I used to break up my ...
customer_reviews.text: This hammer is what I used to break up my aquarium rocks. It handles well and is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cartright

customer_reviews.title: Great rock hammer
customer_reviews.text: Great rock hammer! This got me through my field camp and will probably see me through the next 20-30 years of field work! Very durable!
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my uses, but is a little soft on the hammer end.
customer_reviews.author: sbodie29

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice solid hammer, i can't wait to go use it this summer.
customer_reviews.author: matster72

customer_reviews.title: Great size, shape
customer_reviews.text: Can't wait to use it to smash rocks! Great size, shape, build and price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Clariday

customer_reviews.title: Valuable Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my tween son to use with large rocks we have in our fields. He is a bit of an explorer. It is a real rock pick hammer, so I know caution needs to be taken and an adult must be present when he uses this. I was a bit hesitant to buy it for him, but he knows the rule. It is a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: ThePoshMom

customer_reviews.title: It smashes!
customer_reviews.text: I liked this hammer. It smashes, pulverizes, and whacks stuff real good.
customer_reviews.author: michael rogers

customer_reviews.title: Good for first hammer
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for personal use as my first rock hammer. For a serial hobbiest like myself, this may be a good tool to use to find out if you really want to get serious about rocks. It's fairly well balanced although a bit heavy. It's also pretty soft; I found that the pick portion dulled very fast. After using it a few times, I found myself wishing that I had just spent the extra money and purchased a higher end hammer. This would probably be a good hammer for kids who are beginning to explore rock hounding or for someone who just wants one for a single outing. I would not recommend this for serious long term use.
customer_reviews.author: rikis

product_meta.title: SE 20 oz. Rock Pick Hammer - 8399-RH-ROCK
product_meta.description:
SE is proud to present our 20 oz. Rock Pick Hammer—created especially with contractors, everyday users, prospectors, and rock hounds in mind. This heavy, well-balanced, 20 oz. rock hammer is fully polished and forged of one piece of steel. It has a comfortable grip handle and comes with a reusable heavy-duty plastic tip cover.

Important:
Avoid getting counterfeit items. Genuine SE products come with our SE logo on the packaging.

SE products are quality items for extremely reasonable prices. SE is committed to providing the customer with the best source for value possible on the market. You will enjoy the quality, function and usefulness this SE 8399-RH-ROCK 20 oz. Rock Pick Hammer has to offer.

SE is a registered trademark protected by US Trademark Law.
